alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 23 at 11:35PM CDT until May 24 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Archer County in northern Texas... Southwestern Wichita County in northern Texas... Southeastern Wilbarger County in northern Texas... Eastern Baylor County in northern Texas... * Until 1215 AM CDT. * At 1133 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Lake Kemp to 5 miles south of Westover, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...West Texas Mesonet. At 1115 PM CDT, the Seymour Mesonet site recorded a 76 mph wind gust. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Southwestern Wichita Falls, Archer City, Iowa Park, Holliday, Megargel, Lake Diversion, Dundee, Mankins, Westover, Lake Kickapoo, and Pleasant Valley. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
